title: fix(utils): Re-export prost
body:
until shortly before the next minor release, just to make sure that subsequent patch releases don't unexpectedly break downstream consumers code.

Originally introduced via 6be8c495 (#4087).

title: fix(deps): fix --locked build on rust 1.86
body:
Noticed when rebuilding 0.42.1 for rust 1.86.

The cause is https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/10184, and the fix is updating the `wit-parser` dependency to 0.221.3

title: performance(render): improve rendering performance by consolidating renders and introducing repaint_delay
body: This improves the overall rendering performance of the tool (greatly mitigating various "flickering" issues caused in applications that do not perform synchronized renders) by consolidating renders to the `Screen` thread and introducing an async repaint_delay of 10ms.

title: build: Don't re-export foreign crates in utils
body:
`zellij-utils` previously re-exported a bundle of foreign dependencies at the crate root. These were happily used by other zellij components across the codebase in favor of directly depending on these crates.

This raises a few problems:

1. While coding, it's hard to tell apart which parts of `zellij-utils` are our own code and which are foreign. This bloats the API surface by an enormous amount.
2. Dependants of `zellij-utils` don't enumerate their dependencies correctly: Since zellij-utils re-exports a lot of things, other crates don't define these dependencies themselves. This makes it look like a dependency is used only in zellij utils until the point where you try to remove it and distant parts of the code fall apart

In order to make future work with dependencies easier, this removes the re-exports in zellij-utils and instead makes the respective dependants depend on these packages directly. Where appropriate, dependencies used by multiple components are turned into workspace dependencies to make it clear they're used in multiple places.

title: build: Don't use default features
body: but instead specify all the dependency features we need/want explicitly. This cuts down the number of dependencies in the compilation from 587 to 565 and also makes our code more robust against unexpected changes in upstream default features.

title: chore: Introduce workspace dependencies
body: and deduplicate dependency entries across all non-plugin workspace members. In the future this hopefully makes dependency upgrade easier since shared dependencies need only be touched in one location.

title: refactor(terminal): log scroll region as tuple rather than Option<tuple>
body:
This is a long overdue refactor to the terminal code to keep track of the scroll_region as a tuple rather than an `Option`.

The only functional change is that the scroll region lines are not explicitly padded now (which they shouldn't really have been in the first place).

title: fix(mouse): fix mouse handling in windows terminal (#4065)
body:
Fix handling of mouse any-event tracking in Windows Terminal by updating to a newer version of `termwiz` that introduces a fix.
Fixes #4065

title: Styling fixes in the "about" plugin
body:
Hey @imsnif,

in preparation for the next release I had a glance at the startup tips and feature highlights (nice job, btw). I noticed some minor "bugs" so here are the fixes for that (see first two commits).

While reading through the tips in the "about" plugin I also noticed that keybindings aren't formatted nor painted consistently. Before I go about fixing that I wanted to know: Was that a deliberate choice, or may I go ahead and bring them in line with how we format keys in e.g. the status-bar plugin?

title: Fix compiler warnings
body:
Second attempt to fix compiler warnings, supersedes https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/4026

It turns out that the update to the `xshell` crate (beyond release 0.2.2) breaks the way stdin is handled there, making it impossible to invoke zellij through `cargo xtask` (e.g. via `cargo x run`). This applies to other subcommands as well I guess, but I didn't care to investigate further.

The older version of `xshell` introduces some undefined `cfg` directives, but we silence them manually here. A *proper* fix will have to wait until xshell@0.3.0, which doesn't have an ETA yet.

@imsnif Would you mind giving this a try to make sure I don't accidentally break your workflow again? (sorry!)

title: fix(selection): add proper multi-click dragging options
body: This fixes some issues with the new multiple-mouse-click feature for marking word/line boundaries on double-triple click. Namely, the selection is now properly taken into account on mouse drag in these scenarios.

title: fix(stacked): stacked panes can't resize status-bar
body:
Fixed a number of other typos and issues I came across, but the last commit is the one that actually solves the resize issue!

There is another experiment on `tll-pane-resizer-with-stackinfo` for the future when we have <N panes above / below>

I might need @imsnif's help to write a test if one is wanted!

title: fix(ui): add split right/down shortcut hints to the status-bar
body: This adds the `Split Right` and `Split Down` shortcuts (by default `r` and `d` in `PANE` mode) to the status-bar display. This is important as they will be more widely used with the new `stacked resize` feature, since they can also now split stacks (eg. one can split a full-screen stack to the right in order to make it take up half the screen and create a multiple-select).

title: fix(grid): out of bounds removal when app does not update its scroll region on resize
body: This fixes a minor issue where some apps using scroll region rotate would try to clear the scroll region bounds before they updated them to the terminal window size (eg. after a resize). While this is an error on the app side (I think it comes from ncurses), we should be able to handle this without crashing. This fixes that!

title: fix(plugins): prevent paging plugins from cache at runtime
body: This is a fix for an issue where if one would run a development instance of Zellij that shared cache with a release instance, plugins would sometimes be paged from the HD, causing segfaults. More info here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/10283#issuecomment-2692084111

title: fix(serialization): stacked panes fixes
body: This includes various fixes for serializing stacked panes. These issues were mainly spotted when using the `zellij action dump-layout` and when using session serialization. These now work properly with multiple stacks in various configurations.

title: fix(panes): multiplayer stack issues
body: This fixes various issues that happened when combining multiplayer and stacked panes. Namely having to do with the stack focus moving for all clients if only one client moves focus for it.

title: fix(panes): when focusing pane off the tab edge, break ties with active_at instead of y
body: This fixes an annoying UX issue where when focusing panes off the screen edge using `Alt <arrows>`, the selectable pane with the lowest x would be focused on the relevant edge regardless of which one was previously active. Now these ties will be broken with `active_at` instead of the opposite direction, which is a much better user experience.

title: fix(toolchain): Unbreak client startup
body:
This reverts commit 9f900a7325304a06d9e0913a8e661d7bbc86ad04.

It seems that some of the changes in here break client startup, preventing the client from successfully attaching to the server process. I should investigate this further.

title: fix(panes): various fixes for rendering stacked panes without pane frames
body:
Seeing as the next release will have a lot to do with stacked panes, this issues fixes for lots of issues we've previously had with custom stacked panes layouts when pane frames are not drawn.

The above should now render and behave properly as expected by the user (including rendering, resizing, mouse clicks, etc.)

Here's a screenshot to demonstrate:

fix(about): more verbose config readonly error
body:
This adds a more verbose error to the startup tips when unable to permanently dismiss them due to the config being read only (or some other error).

This now shows a more verbose error inviting the user to manually add the specific line to their config file.

title: chore(deps): update some dependencies
body: This updates `rmp-serde` and `rustix` to avoid some potential crashes.

title: fix(stacked-panes): better handling of adding new panes to a stack
body: This fixes some issues with stacked panes where they would fill up beyond the minimum terminal size and thus rain havoc with our constraint system.

title: feat(plugins): add tab history to the `SessionUpdate` Event
body:
This gives plugins access to the tab history of each connected client through the `SessionUpdate` Event (meaning they will also be available for other sessions).

The tab history is an ascending zero-indexed vector of the previously visited tabs of each client. So for example `0 1 3` means that the user's last visited tab index is `3`, before that `1` and before that `0`. The current tab never appears in the list, so it might not be linear.

title: fix(pinned-panes): allow pinning floating plugin panes with the mouse
body: Fixes an issue with the recently added "pinned panes" feature where one would not be able to pin floating plugin panes with the mouse.

title: fix(floating-panes): reset swap floating layouts when closing last floating pane
body: This fixes an issue where the swap layouts would remain "damaged" after closing the last floating pane (if they were damaged beforehand).

title: fix(tiled-panes): recover from full stack
body: This fixes an issue with the new stacked-resize where we would mess up the layout if adding a pane to a full stack.

title: fix(logging): segfault in chrono crate
body: This fixes an occasional segfault that happened in the `chrono` crate (used for our logger) when logging from an async task (eg. when loading plugins).

title: fix(clipboard): clipboard message
body:
This fixes some issues with the "Text copied to clipboard" message:
1. The message now properly appears with an opaque background
2. The message now also appears in the compact layout
3. The message does not jitter when double-clicking a word to copy it

title: fix(ux): some filepicker improvements
body:
This improves the filepicker (strider) UI somewhat, and also adds the ability to close a plugin once it has replaced itself with another pane.

In Strider this is used when opening a file in place of strider, or when using the "open terminal here" functionality.

title: feat(ui): resize shortcuts
body: This conditionally adds the resize alt-shortcuts (`Alt <+->`) to the UI if there is more than one tiled/floating pane. The change focus shortcuts now also fall under this condition. Meaning if there's only one tiled/floating pane, we'll only see the `new` and `floating` alt shortcut indicators, and otherwise we'll see all four (`new`, `change focus`, `resize`, `floating`).

title: chore(repo): convert themes to the new spec
body:
This converts the built-in themes to the new spec. I also made some effort to make sure all themes do not use the background color to mark text (so that it doesn't appear as if the Zellij text selection isn't working if one uses the theme's background color as their terminal background).

Some of these themes still require some work - which was out of scope for me here - but I'll accept contributions if people want to work on them.

title: feat(mouse): double-click to mark word boundaries, triple-click to mark paragraph
body:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b1c73658-4d7b-4321-bd30-36f6933a4222



This implements the much requested feature where double-clicking a word the the mouse marks it, and triple clicking it marks the entire paragraph (canonical line).

This also somewhat changes the behavior of marking text. Previously, when we marked text with the mouse, it would immediately be copied to the clipboard and the selection would disappear from the screen.

This changes it so that the text is still immediately copied to the clipboard, but the selection stays on screen until the user sends another input (keyboard click or mouse click). I feel this is more convenient and closer to how other applications which allow marking text behave.

body:
This adds 12 unique Zellij usage tips that will appear when a session start, and can be browsed or dismissed.

It's possible to disable them through the config by adding `show_startup_tips false` to the Zellij configuration, or through the tips themselves by pressing `Ctrl c` - which will add this line to the config for you.

No code paths existed to clear sixel images when handling csi dispatch for clear.

Fixes #3173

title: feat(ui): about plugin and release notes
body:
This adds the `about` plugin, which at the moment serves as release notes shown on first run of each new version:

![img-2025-02-10-114523](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e42b567-45c2-4ee0-a635-98761e44b584)

This also adds the `Hover` mouse even to plugins, allowing them to react to the user moving the mouse over the plugin itself (also ofc receiving the relevant coordinates).

title: fix(break-pane): strip logical position when inserting pane to new tab
body:
This fixes an issue with the yet-to-be-released logical position refactor where panes broken into a new tab under certain conditions would crash or disappear.

The issue was that the logical position from the previous tab was kept and cause chaos. This fixes it by stripping it before adding the pane to the new tab.

title: fix(floating-panes): when changing coordinates, if a pane is not floating - make it floating
body: This is a small fix to the recent change-floating-panes plugin API, to make it so that if a pane is tiled or suppressed - changing its floating coordinates would make it floating.

title: feat(plugins): send info about $EDITOR and $SHELL
body:
This adds an `editor` and `shell` optional fields to the `ModeInfo` sent on `ModeUpdate` to plugins.
Meaning plugins would be able to (for example) use the user's default shell to launch commands and shell aliases (if they have permission). Also to display helpful information to the user about which program would be used to edit files in the built-in editor.

title: feat(plugins): Allow opening panes near plugin
body:
Currently, plugins are only able to open new panes from the perspective of the user. For example, if a user is focused in a different tab than the plugin, the plugin could only open panes in that tab.

This adds new plugin API methods that allow a plugin to open new panes "near" it. So for example, if a plugin would use the new `open_terminal_near_plugin` command, the terminal will be opened near in its own tab regardless of whether the user is focused on it or not (and it will also not change the user focus).

The APIs that were added:
`open_terminal_near_plugin`
`open_terminal_floating_near_plugin`
`open_terminal_in_place_of_plugin` (will override the plugin pane with the terminal until the terminal is closed, at which point the plugin will reappear)

`open_command_pane_near_plugin`
`open_command_pane_floating_near_plugin`
`open_command_pane_in_place_of_plugin` (will override the plugin pane with the command pane until the command pane is closed, at which point the plugin will reappear)


`open_file_near_plugin`
`open_file_floating_near_plugin`
`open_file_in_place_of_plugin` (will override the plugin pane with the editor pane until the editor pane is closed, at which point the plugin will reappear)

title: fix(tiled-panes): opening panes from the cli
body: This fixes an issue in main introduced by the recent stacked-resize feature where tiled panes would not be opened from the CLI. Thanks @dj95 for the find!

title: feat(plugins): add `PastedText` Event
body:
This makes it so that if a user pastes text while focused on a plugin, the text will arrive in one go with the new `PastedText` event rather than character by character as before.

This should make it much easier to invite users to paste text into plugins and handle it as a whole rather than rendering on each keystroke and trying to figure out when the paste ended with debounces and other methods.

title: feat(plugins): API to change floating pane coordinates
body:
This adds both a plugin API and a CLI command to change the coordinates (x, y, width, height and pinned/not-pinned) of floating panes.

EDIT: forgot to mention, this also adds a `viewport_rows`, `viewport_columns`, `display_area_rows` and `display_area_columns` to `TabInfo` so that plugins can know the size of the screen (makes it easier to use the above APIs to eg. center panes, position them relative to each other, etc.)

title: feat(ui): stacked resize
body:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53ce1597-2c13-4e85-bd50-aa7d427b93cd

This changes the default Zellij resize algorithm to a new one called "stacked resize". It is demonstrated in the short video above.

In a gist:
1. When resizing a pane with Alt +/- (non-directional resize), Zellij will try to first resize it by 30% (instead of the current 5%) and if unable to do so, will try to create a stack out of it with its neighbors. This happens in each direction, first preferring the direction which contains neighbors geometrically contained within the pane's relevant boundaries (horizontal/vertical depending on the direction).
2. When already inside a stack and doing a negative non-directional resize (`Alt -`) Zellij will break out a pane from this stack.
3. When adding new panes with `Alt n`, if the swap layouts are dirty (the swap layout indication, by default on the upper right, is not lighted), Zellij will attempt to split the currently focused pane. If it is a stack, Zellij will add a pane to this stack.
4. When splitting a stack right or down (`Ctrl p` + `r` or `Ctrl p` + `d`), Zellij will now split the whole stack in this direction as if it were a normal pane.

This new resize algorithm can be opted-out of by specifying `stacked_resize false` in the config (can also be updated at runtime).

title: Update to Wasmtime 29.0.1
Update rust toolchain to 1.84
body:
Updates the Rust toolchain from 1.75.0 (which is deprecated) to 1.84.0 (which is the latest stable version at the time of this writing).

This update covers quite a few toolchain version changes and necessitates a few changes in our code. See below (or the commits in this PR) for additional information.

I'll keep this open until I'm certain the change doesn't break the application. Most notably I currently get an error in the snapshot tests and I haven't ran a simulated release yet.

Once all of these pass, I'll merge this change.

## Update the `wasm32-wasi` target to `wasm32-wasip1`

The `wasm32-wasi` target has triggered compiler-warnings since 1.81.0 and has been fully removed in January 2025. It has been renamed to `wasm32-wasip1` so that's what we're also using now.

The target has been renamed appropriately in all locations where it was previously used, this includes (afaict):

- Github CI stuff (where it installs the toolchain)
- All plugin configurations
- The toolchain config (in rust-toolchain.toml)
- A few other internal files and functions, mostly for e2e tests and similar


## Other breaking changes

- The `PanicInfo` type has been renamed to `PanicHookInfo` (260be7fb)
- Two clippy lint errors have been introduced that actually uncovered a bug in our code (a9aa1c30, 5a2ca0ec, 50d570d2)


## Other non-breaking changes

- Don't request the `rust-analysis` toolchain component any longer (b2c86ddd)
- Remove the deprecated `Makefile.toml` (29d87505)

title: fix(floating-panes): handle uncaught errors
body: This handles various previously uncaught errors around floating panes.

title: fix(terminal): Support kitty keyboard protocol setting with "="
body:
From
https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/keyboard-protocol/#progressive-enhancement:

> The escape code for requesting enhancements is:

> CSI = flags ; mode u

That means it can be *set* with CSI =, not just pushed/popped onto the stack with CSI < and CSI >.

This is important because otherwise zellij would interpret this as restore_cursor_position, which would move the cursor.

This would be hit by the next fish-shell release, which sends CSI = 5 u and CSI = 0 u to enable/disable the kitty keyboard enhancements unconditionally,
so if you used any program that saved the cursor position it would constantly move your cursor back on every prompt.

Fixes #3852

title: feat(ux): stack panes command
body:
This adds the ability to stack any panes in the session either through a plugin or through the CLI. Given a list of pane IDs (either terminals or plugins), Zellij will create a stack out of them (similar to the one created currently with the "STACKED" swap layout).

Example:
```bash
# This will create a stack of 3 panes (terminal with ID 1, plugin with ID 1 and terminal with ID 2)
zellij action stack-panes -- terminal_1 plugin_1 terminal_2
```

Upcoming PRs will add the ability to do this with mouse clicks and a built-in fuzzy-find plugin.

title: fix(terminal): cursor overflow
body:
This fixes a small issue where in some cases where the application running inside a terminal pane would report an out-of-bounds cursor position, we would render the cursor on the pane border. This was likely introduced during some changes in the past months.

This fixes it as well as one minor issue introduced in a recent PR regarding swap layout placement.

title: fix(layout-applier): logical index pane sorting
body:
This PR fixes, refactors and greatly simplifies the `LayoutApplier`, which has been a big chunk of technical debt ever since we introduced swap layouts.

The gist of the changes: when applying layouts (happens whenever we create new tabs, add new panes, change swap layouts, etc.) we now sort panes by their logical position in the previously applied layout rather than by their contents or relative position.

The previous method - while nice in theory - ended up generating a lot of unexpected janky-ness in these methods for certain edge-cases. For anything but a simple 2-3 pane layout, it was hard to follow or reason about for both users and layout authors.

There are definitely some behavior changes here that might affect existing layouts. My sincerest apologies - this could not be avoided and I feel it's a much better way forward. I'd be happy to work with anyone who experienced breakage from this in order to find workarounds.

This removes a very significant barrier in some really cool upcoming features involving more freely creating stacked panes, applying arbitrary layouts to the current tab, etc.

Happy holidays everyone.

title: Fix Synchronized Output (mode 2026) reporting
body:
Hi, thank you for Zellij!

I help maintain [Textual](https://github.com/textualize/textual/) and some dependent TUI apps like [Posting](https://github.com/darrenburns/posting) which make use of mode 2026.

I started using Zellij yesterday (loving it!) and noticed that the mode 2026 query response was not being parsed as expected and so the output could not be synchronized.

Looking into the code of Zellij, I think the response is missing a `?` character. If I'm understanding correctly, response should be of the format `CSI ? 2026 ; N $ y` where N can be any value in the range 0-4 (inclusive).

References:

- https://gist.github.com/christianparpart/d8a62cc1ab659194337d73e399004036
- https://vt100.net/docs/vt510-rm/DECRPM.html

## Before

Notice the tearing effect as the cursor moves through the list. It's particularly noticeable as the cursor moves over `PATCH`.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/332aaae5-2844-4ac5-a5f6-894df26871f4

## After

On a build containing this fix I cannot reproduce the tearing effect:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d228626d-94c8-40a6-b3ed-becda0662285

Possibly fixes https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/2794

title: feat(ux): pin floating panes
body:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0e89333-86bb-4171-a185-7f51ccfba774



With this change, user can now "pin" floating panes - meaning set them as "always on top" relative to the tiled pane surface. So that they will appear even if the floating pane surface is toggled off.

This can be done:
1. With a mouse-click as shown in the video
2. With a keyboard shortcut (by default `i` in `Pane` mode, so by default: `Ctrl p` + `i`)
3. Through the command line (`zellij action toggle-pane-pinned`)
4. From a plugin with the new `set_floating_pane_pinned` API

Pinned panes are also available in layouts for floating panes and will be respected when resurrecting sessions.

These can be very useful for long running commands that have helpful immediate feedback (eg. logs, compiler output, network device traffic, resource monitors such as `htop`, etc.)

title: fix(multiuser): properly clear fake cursors
body: This fixes an old bug where the fake cursors rendered for other players in multiplayer sessions would sometimes not be properly cleared when their line was not updated (this sometimes happened in older shells like bash or sh).

title: fix(screen): off by 1 error when focusing layout tab
body:
This is a fix for https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3786

The `focus` directive in this case trickled down into an off-by-one error which was causing this (position vs. index). It's now fixed!

title: fix(plugins): properly focus plugin after it was hidden
body:
This is a fix for https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3834 (among other issues).

What was happening here is that `LaunchOrFocusPlugin` was unintentionally going through the logic for switching back to a normal pane after having edited its scrollback with the scrollback editor. The relevant parameter in the function had an outdated name (my bad!) which caused this confusion when implementing this feature in the first place.

Now opening the session-manager properly brings it to the focused tab.

title: fix(plugins): do not detach if using a slash in a session name
body:
Session names cannot contain slashes. Previously, if trying to rename the session or start a new session with a slash in it - Zellij would detach (the check was only made on the client-side *after* detaching from the current session - yikes!)

This fixes the issue by verifying there's no slash in the session name both in the plugin API and in the session-manager plugin (so that it can show an informative error message).

title: chore(repo): add funding.json
body: I decided to add a funding.json file in order to apply for an OSS grant to to help me pay my bills. I'm unsure if anything will come of it - so if nothing does, I'll remove this file in a few months.

title: feat(plugins): allow changing the plugin's `/host` folder (under a new permission)
body:
This adds the ability to change a plugin's `/host` folder at runtime through a new `change_host_folder` plugin command.
This command has been gated behind the new `FullHdAccess` permission, since this means that a plugin will be able to access any part of the HD that the Zellij process itself has access to (which in turn depends on which user runs it), instead of just to the working directory in which the plugin was run.

title: fix(plugins): properly pad UI elements when they have a background
body:
This fixes UI elements to always color text background until the element width if the there is a width and the element has a background.

For example, when doing `print_text_with_coordinates(text_element.selected(), 0, 0, Some(10), None)`, the selection would be colored until the width of 10 characters even if `text_element` is only 8 characters long.

title: fix(plugins): properly focus pane after tab was closed
body:
This fixes a minor issue where the `focus_pane_with_id` and `suppress_pane` plugin API commands would not work properly if a tab was closed.

The issue was that the tab was being focused by its index and not by its position.

title: fix(plugins): derive hash and ord for PaneId
body: This is a minor fix to the plugin API - namely adding the `Hash` and `Ord` derives for the exported `PaneId` type to make it easier to use this type as a key in a `HashMap` and `BTreeMap` in plugins.

title: feat(plugins): add /cache folder
body:
This adds a `/cache` folder accessible to plugins. This folder is similar to the `/data` folder, except Zellij will not delete it when the plugin is unloaded.

Another difference to the `/data` folder is that this folder is shared between all instances of the plugin loaded with the same URL (either remote or local).

This folder is also particular to the current version of Zellij - meaning that the same plugin loaded in a newer version will have a clean `/cache` folder.

Like all of the Zellij cache, this folder can be explicitly deleted by users (eg. to save disk space). It's located inside the Zellij cache folder (whose path can be seen in `zellij setup --check`).

title: fix(screen): send PaneClosed event to plugins also when closing the whole tab
body: The `PaneClosed` event was not being sent to plugins when the pane was closed as a result of closing an entire tab. This fixes it.

title: Vendoring common_path
body:
As mentioned in #3702, this PR should help packaging zellij by avoiding dependency on `common-path`, whose repository is not available anymore.

One thing I haven't done is mentioning the original author. What's the best way to mention them in the source code? Should I just mention it through a comment or should I add it to rustdoc?

title: fix(ux): change plugin manager shortcut
body: This changes `Ctrl d` to `Ctrl f` in the plugin manager for loading a new plugin from disk. This is so that there will be consistency with other built-in plugins (eg. the session-manager) for opening the filepicker.

title: fix(panes): handle various invalid state situations
body:
This fixes various situations in which due to invalid state, Zellij would crash.

These situations were likely exposed due to our recent wasm runtime change.

title: fix(statup): slow startup on some occasions
body:
This fixes an issue where on some occasions the Zellij startup would be delayed by a few seconds until the terminal colors were queried.

This was happening because due to recent changes in the sending retry mechanism, the retry-queue was holding the lock on the session metadata for all messages.

This was fixed by only acquiring the lock when trying to send a message to the server, releasing it before placing it in the retry-loop.

title: chore: add vendored_curl feature
body:
Closes #3720
Supersedes #3745

The additive and by-default nature of the `vendored-curl` feature is the cleanest way I could come up with to retain the old vendored behavior and also achieve the "off switch" that I talk about in the issue above.

title: fix(config): crash if unable to watch config folder
body: This fixes a crash that happened on startup when Zellij did not have read permissions to the config parent folder - ouch!

title: fix(terminal): reset kitty keyboard support when resetting terminal state
body: Minor fix to make sure the kitty keyboard support is reset when resetting the terminal state (eg. using the `reset` command).

title: fix(plugins): do not open extra instances of aliases
body:
This is a fix for `LaunchOrFocusPlugin` (which is used in the default configuration to launch the session-manager, plugin manager and configuration screen) which would previously not work well with plugin aliases (which all the aforementioned use).

This fix makes it so that when launching the session-manager, it will always be the same session-manager.

title: fix(tabs): maintain event order for MoveTab
body:
This is a fix for some out-of-order events that happened due to our recent wasm runtime change.

Namely, `MoveTab` now doesn't happen when there's a pending tab being populated and `HoldPane` explicitly looks for the tab containing the relevant pane id in all cases.

title: fix(output-buffer): truncate grid height when not rendering it fully
body: This fixes a rendering issue where sometimes when terminals would render themselves multiple times while being resized, their output would "spill" onto other panes. This is now fixed by always truncating the rendered buffer to the grid sized, even when it's cached and only partially rendered.

title: fix(plugins): cwd and usability fixes
body:
This includes a few fixes:
1. Maintain plugin cwd when reloading it (eg. through the plugin manager)
2. Default to loading plugins in the foreground through the plugin manager
3. Allow sending space in configuration parameters when starting plugins through the plugin manager

title: fix(input): refix ctrl-j
body:
The previous fix for differentiating `Ctrl j` from `Enter` happened before the re-architecture involved in reloading the configuration at runtime - so it no longer works for anything but the default config (which is now not a thing in itself since we make sure the config is written on first run).

This fixes it by moving the differentiation to the server side.

title: fix(input): remove support for extra modifiers
body:
Implementation of the Kitty Keyboard protocol, especially in regards to the more unusual modifiers such as `NumLock`, `Capslock` etc. varies wildly between terminal emulators. This causes some odd bugs such as keybindings not being recognized when `NumLock` is pressed - but only in some terminals!

To remove the confusion, I removed these keys from Zellij's internal representation. We will still forward them to terminal panes that request them (since we forward the STDIN buffer verbatim) but will not interpret them or send them to plugins.

title: fix(ux): forward keys to pane in locked mode and base mode rather than hard-coded normal mode
body:
This fixes an issue where keys would be forwarded to panes only in locked mode and hard-coded normal mode. Which is alright for the default preset, but not so much for unlocked-first (because then they would also be forwarded when the interface is unlocked and one must press single-letter aliases to enter the different modes).

This fixes it by forwarding the keys in locked mode always and also in the base mode (in unlocked-first the base mode is locked mode, so this works fine).

title: fix(ux): configuration fixes
body:
This includes a few fixes for the `configuration` screen:
1. The `<TAB>` indicator was partially cut off, not is isn't
2. `Ctrl s` was rebound to `Ctrl a` (because it's already bound in the `Default` preset)
3. The `RebindingLeaders` screen was removed from the `PresetsScreen` because it was deemed too confusing for users. The same functionality can be achieved by choosing a preset and then rebinding the leaders if desired.

title: style(fmt): remove warnings
body: Remove compilation cargo warnings from plugins

title: style(fmt): various cleanups
body: This addresses the cargo warnings as well as fixes a minor rounding error in the configuration UI

title: fix(layouts): suspend commands in remote layouts
body:
When loading layouts from a remote url (eg. `zellij -l https://example.com/my-layout.kdl`), Zellij will now suspend all commands inside these layouts behind a "Waiting to run `<command>`", prompting the user to press `<ENTER>` to run the specified command.

This is a security measure to make it safer to load such layouts without having them potentially run arbitrary commands on the user's machine.

Normal layouts loaded locally will not be affected.

title: fix(configuration): leave notification up when base mode changes
body: This is a minor fix for the new configuration plugin that prevents the "configuration applies to current session" notification from disappearing when the base input mode changes (eg. from `normal` to `locked`).

title: fix(terminal): recover from partial line drop
body:
This is a fix for https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3525

The issue that was happening here is that a canonical line exceeded the scrollback size and was only partially dropped. Then when scrolling back down we were trying to connect its non-canonical edge to it. This should not have happened, but my guess is that due to some recent algorithm changes in this area this situation became possible.

For this reason we now recover from this situation by making the partial line canonical (which is probably nicer anyway).

title: fix(plugins): make sure to always render on first resize
body:
Probably due to the recent runtime change, there were some occasions in which plugins weren't rendered on first run (caused by an implicit dependency on event ordering). This fixes it by always rendering plugins (regardless of their internal state) on first load (first resize event).

Good catch @Zykino !!

title: fix(plugins): rebind insert
body:
Rebind insert key in the plugin manager and configuration, since it doesn't exist on macOS (thanks @dj95 !)

This also fixes an issue where if the tab-bar or status-bar were closed through the plugin manager, the UI would get stuck. Right now, due to the built-in swap layouts, another pane fills their place - but this will be fixed at another time. Right now I preferred to leave this option open in order to empower users to make this decision on their own.

title: fix(ux): new interface/configuration touch-ups
body:
This includes two fixes:

1. Bring back the "copied to clipboard" indication to the new UI
2. Make is possible to scroll out of a scrolled pane without resetting the scroll (previously only possible with the mouse, now also with `Alt+<arrows>` or `Alt+<hjkl>`.

title: feat(ui): bring back fullscreen indication
body:
This brings back the full indication that has been removed when the UI was changed recently. Here, instead of having it on the extra status-bar line (which now does not exist) we add it to the tab name. The upshot of which is that we can see if a tab is in full-screen even if we're not focused on it.

![img-2024-10-22-160715](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bb30c9c9-454b-4447-98cb-37b2bddb8762)

title: feat(plugins): add API to list clients, their focused panes and running commands/plugins
body:
This adds a plugin API that returns an `Event::ListClients` with info about the running clients, their focused pane and the running command inside this pane (or the plugin url).

This is an API version of `zellij action list-clients` so that plugins don't have to rely on the command line to get this info.

title: feat(ui): rebind keys UI
body:
This adds to the configuration UI, allowing users to rebind keys at runtime for their current configuration without overriding their entire config.

This allows users to change the primary/secondary modifiers (by default `Ctrl` for changing modes and `Alt` for common shortcuts respectively) when in the default preset:

![img-2024-10-21-103445](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c432fb00-7b0e-40df-8dc0-98c3a605e7c0)

In the "Unlock First" (non-colliding) keybinding preset, this also allows users to change the leader key (by default `Ctrl g`):

![img-2024-10-21-103526](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dc10b625-32c2-4c5c-955a-571f58575343)

Keybind presets (i.e. switching from `default` to `unlock-first (non-colliding)` can still be done in the `Change mode behavior` screen, accessible through `<TAB>` as indicated in the UI):

![img-2024-10-21-103728](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/05fe0966-cf46-4d88-94fb-26daeb2e149f)

The `configuration` can be accessed with `Ctrl o` + `c` (or `Ctrl g` + `o` + `c` in unlock-first).

title: Update to Wasmtime 21.0.2
body:
This fixes a race condition which causes occasional crashes and may enable a sandbox escape:

<https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/security/advisories/GHSA-7qmx-3fpx-r45m>

title: feat(plugins): add configurable black background for ui components
body: In https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/3658#issuecomment-2414485167 we've discovered, that terminals handle transparency different (even with different platforms like linux and macOS!). Thus it would be good to give plugin maintainers the ability to retain at least the transparent background in their plugins. In order to implement this, I've made one small addition to the line protocol, but very carefully to retain backwards compatibility. **Demo** --- ### Transparent If a utf-8 separated byte list begins with a clear-text z, it will be considered "transparent". Eg. ``` Pzribbon;z114,105,98,98,111,110,32,49\ ``` --- I've just implemented it to the `Text` and `NestedListItem` for now as a kind of proof-of-concept. In case you agree with this small addition, I can implement the flag also to the remaining components. Please feel also free to close this pull request, in case you do not agree to this solution. I can also understand if you don't want to make changes to the protocol :)

title: feat(plugins): rebind keys api
body:
This adds a plugin API that allows plugins to explicitly unbind/rebind certain keys in certain modes, rather than change the entire runtime configuration in order to rebind one or two keys.

This API also uses the internal `KeyWithModifier`, `InputMode` and `Action` entities rather than making plugins send a stringified KDL config.

Context: I plan on using this in the upcoming "rebind primary/secondary/superkey" PR that will add a UI to the configuration allowing users to change these modifiers without changing their entire config at runtime like is possible now through the setup wizard/configuration.

title: fix(config): watch/update config given with --config when appropriate
body: After this change, if a session is started with `--config <path>` the <path> will be watched for configuration changes (and be updated when the configuration is written to disk) rather than the default config path.

title: fix(plugins): allow switching to a new session with cwd without specifying a layout
body:
This adds a new plugin API `switch_session_with_cwd` that allows switching to a new session with the default layout and specifying a cwd (eg. `/tmp`).

This also includes some fixes that get `default_cwd` to work once more when specified as a CLI option.

title: fix(plugins): do not allow attaching to the same session
body: This prevents a hard-crash when plugins attempt to attach to the same session (which is not allowed). Instead, we log an error in the Zellij logs.

title: fix(resurrection): plugin alias resurrection
body:
Previously when resurrecting a session that was created with plugin aliases, the resurrection metadata would only convert the plugin aliases to their respective plugins+configuration for the `tab`s themselves and not for the `new_tab_template`. This had the effect that while the session would be resurrected properly, opening new tabs in the resurrected session would only work if the alias was in the config (or not work at all if the plugin configuration was contained in the `default_tab_template`, for example).

This fixes the issue by properly serializing the `new_tab_template` node as well with the translated plugin+config rather than relying on the alias still being there in the config.

This should be a fix for https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3521.

title: fix(plugins): force use curl system lib on macOS
body:
There were in the past some problems with downloading plugins via HTTPS on macOS (https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3036#issuecomment-2024214955, https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3479#issuecomment-2407490553).

The cause is, that curl is not properly recognised when building zellij, especially after the latest changes to the isahc crate in favour of surf. This results in zellij not being linked to `libcurl`, which utilises some other dependencies in the background to implement the functionality, that results in crashes for certain scenarios. 

This pull request fixes the issue, as it forces `curl-sys` to use system libs of macOS instead of choosing it on its own. On my macOS with nix as build environment and in a VM with curl installed via brew, the issue is fixed and zellij is not crashing anymore.

In case there are some errors on linux, even though it was tested, we could introduce a target selector (`[target.'cfg(target_os = "macos")'.dependencies]`).

title: fix(plugins): various plugin api and other fixes
body:
This fixes:
1. Plugins can now no-longer make unselectable panes selectable
2. We now make sure the cache/config folders are created on app start (this prevents some races with the http downloading client).
